text:
> should CRM development tools be available with Content Hub Enterprise
That is correct, it's only available for Sales and Service Hub ENT as of now

Is there a way to refresh the CRM card or call a function when you close a CRM Preview Window?

For context, i am using the CrmActionButton to create/associate a new contact on my company object but i need to add the new contact to a list on the CRM card once they have been associated. Thanks in advance

I know there is a feature to refresh the card if a property changes. maybe you could use the associated contacts number property to refresh it so  when you create the new association it triggers a re-render. I havent used that refresh functionality so maybe what im saying doesnt work but just brainstorming a little bit

Hi,

I'm trying to create a button that will allow a user to send a pre-populated, customizable one-to-one-email using CRM Actions in a UI Extension. Is this possible? I want it to be populated by the data in the table in the UI Extension.
I want to know this, as well.
This is what we're trying to be able to do, as well.
We would like this feature, as well.
I just discovered that there are a number of people wanting to have this feature,
We came up with a great workaround, which I will share soon

<@U013TUP19PS> very curious to see your workaround ! Setting the from-address would be very nice and I see in this thread that there might be something in planning by HubSpot: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Default-email-address-for-sending-from-CRM/idi-p/8727>

<@U03FJQPSC0Y> 1: It is the objects read or batch read and the associations. Historically as well search API but in many cases this was replaced by GQL which helps us to not get into the narrow API limit for search API.
2: It is something like all deals attached to a ticket and the line_items of the deals. When we do a CPQ solution it is searching the products as well which is not possible at scale so we use external cache / database instead.
3.: a.) Product searches with logic like a pattern in a certain product category b.) a good error handling when GQL complexity points reduce the size of the returned message
